@alquraishi

Keras has support of padding with a performance hit. I don't know if it's better/worst than if implemented using CuDNN's native support (which is also expensive).

inputs to cudnn_rnn classes have 3 dims: [time_steps, batch_size, input_dim]. The 3rd dim is a constant which doesn't change across batches. It's a requirement for all LSTM impl, regardless of what devices they are.
